title: Historical Stock Splits and Corporate Actions of Cooper-Standard Holdings Inc

content.text: In November 1993, Cooper-Standard Holdings Inc conducted its initial public offering, listing on the New York Stock Exchange under the ticker symbol CPS.
On October 6, 1997, Cooper-Standard Holdings Inc announced a 2-for-1 stock split. This split increased the number of outstanding shares and adjusted the stock price accordingly.
Cooper-Standard Holdings Inc implemented another 2-for-1 stock split on October 2, 2000. This split aimed to improve liquidity and accessibility for investors.
On June 25, 2003, Cooper-Standard Holdings Inc announced a 2-for-1 stock split. This split aimed to enhance marketability and trading activity for the company's shares.
Cooper-Standard Holdings Inc implemented another 2-for-1 stock split on January 31, 2005. This split aimed to attract more investors by reducing the stock price.
On November 29, 2010, Cooper-Standard Holdings Inc announced a 2-for-1 stock split. This split aimed to improve the overall marketability and trading liquidity of the company's shares.
Cooper-Standard Holdings Inc implemented another 2-for-1 stock split on June 1, 2015. This split aimed to increase affordability and trading volume of the company's shares.

On June 26, 2017, Cooper-Standard Holdings Inc announced the acquisition of Lauren Manufacturing and Lauren Plastics, two companies specializing in polymer products. This acquisition aimed to expand Cooper-Standard's product portfolio and strengthen its market position.

news.headline: Cooper-Standard Holdings: Solid Quarterly Results And Technical Chart
news.summary: Cooper-Standard Holdings posted its first profitable quarter since 2021, and the industry trend looks positive. Find out why CPS stock is a Buy.

news.headline: Cooper Standard FlushSeal™ System Named SPE® Automotive Innovation Award Finalist
news.summary: Cooper Standard (NYSE: CPS) has been recognized as a 2023 Society of Plastics Engineers (SPE) Automotive Innovation Award finalist for its FlushSeal™ System found on several NIO models. The innovation, which is recognized in the Body Exterior category, is one of 28 technologies named a finalist in the annual program that honors the best companies in automotive plastics.
